title: Authors and Citation
text: Sigrist S, Skorik S (2023). “universityrankingafrica: University Ranking Africa.”
code: @Misc{sigristskorik,   title = {universityrankingafrica: University Ranking Africa},   author = {Samuel Sigrist and Sophia Skorik},   year = {2023},   abstract = {Data from institutional and national levels was combined into a dataset to provide a comprehensive characterization of the top ranked Universities of every African country. This was done to demonstrate the correlation of certain attributes with the academic ranking performance. The dataset also highlights the difficulties of accessing data from many African Universities online.},   version = {0.0.0.9000}, }

text: data collected April June 2023 using official websites Universities. ranking data originates Ranking Web Universities. ’s worth noting World Ranking comprises 11’997 universities, African Ranking accounts 2’064 universities. data collection hand, decided consider 3 () highest ranked universities African country. gathered data offers interesting insights African academic landscape, mostly process combing 140 websites search information. Assisting institutions improving quality web contents one possible avenue cooperation African universities future. package provides access two data sets. ranking data set 26 variables 141 observations. overview variable names, see following table. african_countries data set 7 variables 55 observations. overview variable names, see following table.

what: 1) Mapping Countries with the Best-Ranked Universities
title: University Ranking Africa
text: code demonstrates create map R highlights countries hosting top-ranked universities. method involves picking best university country associating rank specific country.
code: library(universityrankingafrica) library(tidyverse) library(sf) library(rnaturalearth)   top_ranked_per_country <- african_countries |>    select(countries, best_uni_rank)   world <- ne_countries(scale = "medium", returnclass = "sf") africa_map <- left_join(world,                          top_ranked_per_country, by = c("name_long" = "countries")) |>     filter(continent == "Africa")  ggplot() +   theme_void() +   geom_sf(data = africa_map, aes(fill = best_uni_rank), color = "white", lwd = 0) +   scale_fill_gradientn(name =  paste("Rank Africa", "\n(out of 2'064)"),                         trans = "log",                        labels = scales::label_number(accuracy = 1),                        colors = c("#2E8B57","#9DBF9E", "#FCB97D", "#A84268"),                        na.value = "grey80",                        guide = guide_colorbar(title.position = "top", title.vjust = 1.5)) +   labs(title = "Top-Ranked Universities in Africa",        subtitle = "Comparison of the Highest-Ranked University in each African Country",        caption = "Source: Ranking Web of Universities (https://www.webometrics.info/en/Africa)") +   theme(legend.position = c(-0.1, 0.3), legend.direction = "horizontal",         plot.title = element_text(size = 20, hjust = 0, vjust = 0),         plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10, hjust = 0, vjust = 0.5),         plot.caption = element_text(size = 10, color = "darkgray", hjust = -0.6)) +   coord_sf(ylim = c(-40, 40))

what: 2) Exploring Colonial’s Legacy on African University Ranking
title: University Ranking Africa
text: analysis investigates whether correlation exists colonial power previously governed African nations current university rankings.
code: library(universityrankingafrica) library(tidyverse) library(broom)  data <- ranking |>    filter(colonial_power %in% c("United Kingdom", "France", "Belgium", "Italy", "Portugal"))  # Create a scatter plot ggplot(data, aes(x = colonial_power, y = rank_africa)) +   geom_point() +   labs(x = "Colonial Power at Independence", y = "Africa Rank") +   ggtitle("University Ranking in Africa vs Colonial Power at Independence") # Perform linear regression model <- lm(rank_africa ~ colonial_power, data = data) print(tidy(model)) #> # A tibble: 5 × 5 #>   term                         estimate std.error statistic p.value #>   <chr>                           <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 (Intercept)                     449.       168.     2.68  0.00834 #> 2 colonial_powerFrance            201.       182.     1.11  0.271   #> 3 colonial_powerItaly            -302.       335.    -0.900 0.370   #> 4 colonial_powerPortugal           80.3      237.     0.339 0.735   #> 5 colonial_powerUnited Kingdom   -117.       181.    -0.646 0.519  print(summary(model)$r.squared) #> [1] 0.0895955

previous_headings: Example > 2) Exploring Colonial’s Legacy on African University Ranking
title: University Ranking Africa
text: model doesn’t provide strong evidence specific colonial powers (France, Italy, Portugal, United Kingdom) significantly predict university rankings Africa based p-values greater conventional thresholds like 0.05.. low R-squared value indicates model might explain much variability university rankings, suggesting factors beyond colonial power might influence rankings significantly.

title: University Ranking Africa — ranking
text: tibble 141 rows 26 variables: university Name University country Country University located city City University located ror_entry_correct entry ror.org-website corresponding University correct? "n"-cases, stated website incorrect url Official website University website_secure website use https? security related pop-upon opening website? website_up_to_date news articles website date copyright date website current year? website_function Good: navigating website smooth, dead redundant links. Medium: dead links within webpage, placeholders ("lorem ipsum") still visible, blank empty pages. Poor: Navigating website difficult. Defunct: official link university's website longer hosted, otherwise inaccessible. Note: indicate much information can found website. website_language Default language landing site colonial_power colonial Power country gained independence, ever colonized became independent. rank_africa rank University Africa, according https://www.webometrics.info/en/Ranking_africa rank_world rank University World, according https://www.webometrics.info/en/Ranking_africa impact_rank impact rank University, according https://www.webometrics.info/en/Ranking_africa openness_rank openness rank University, according https://www.webometrics.info/en/Ranking_africa excellence_rank excellence rank University, according https://www.webometrics.info/en/Ranking_africa academic_system academic system used University: American (Undergraduate, Graduate, Doctorate) French (LMD: Licence, Master, Doctorat) engineering_courses number different undergraduate engineering courses University offers. years_of_study Stated duration undergraduate engineering degree.
